description: Dive into "Explore Kota Kinabalu's Hidden Free Gems" â€” a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Explore Kota Kinabalu's Hidden Free Gems

places.generalDescription: Tanjung Aru Perdana Park is a popular city park in Kota Kinabalu, featuring lakeside jogging trails, kids' play areas, and nightly musical fountain performances. It's a great place to spend time with friends without spending much money. The park offers winding paths with water ponds, green spaces, and shady trees for relaxation. At night, the colorful musical fountain show adds excitement and joy to the atmosphere, making it an ideal spot for evening strolls and relaxation.

sources.snippet: To know: Touring Tanjung Aru Perdana Park is such a delightful experience, which makes visiting it one of the cheap things to do in Kota Kinabalu with your friends and spend a great time at zero cost. To do: If you are looking for a place to spend a pleasant day with your companions without spending so much money, then we advise you to visit Tanjung Aru Perdana Park, where youâ€™ll be able to take a stroll through its numerous twists and turns that are brimming with the water ponds and appealing green spaces as well as thick trees, making it one of the best parks in Kota Kinabalu, and youâ€™ll also have the chance to unwind in the available seating areas ..
sources.shortName: Best 4 free and cheap things to do in Kota Kinabalu

sources.snippet: Tanjung Aru Perdana Park, or Perdana Park, is a beautiful park filled with recreational activities and amenities. This is one of the best places to witness a sunset as well as dine at some of the popular eateries here that offer authentic Malaysian cuisine. Besides the sunset views, there is a musical fountain that involves specific bursts of water synchronised to music and lights.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things To Do In Kota Kinabalu, Malaysia

sources.snippet: Perdana Park is a beautifully landscaped recreational area perfect for picnics and leisurely strolls. The park features a musical fountain, jogging paths, and plenty of shaded areas, making it a favourite spot for families and friends to gather and enjoy outdoor activities. Address: Tanjung Aru, 88100 Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia
sources.shortName: 30 Best Things To Do In Kota Kinabalu Town, Tourist Attractions & More

places.name: Tanjung Aru Perdana Park

reviews.text: The park is clean and fresh which located just 10 minutes walk from the Beach, a public Recreation Centre for you to windup after full day working while enjoying the colourful musical Water Fountain. If you don't mind about the RM1.00 each of parking fee and Toilet, then this will be the third best place to kill your time effectively and in the healthy way too. Ignore the Ice Cream snapshots okay, I just can't get off my eyes seeing all those sweet tooth desserts in front of me hahaha. Anyway, that's all from me - stay healthy guys!^.*

Place needs a little more maintenance. However, still a nice place for a stroll or a jog. Lights could be a bit brighter since it's open until 10 pm. Playground is worn down and taped off but didn't stop a few children from playing. Hopefully it's still safe to do so.

All in One.

The Safest and Best recreational area in Kota Kinabalu.

One of it's main attraction is the beautiful colourful synchronised melody water-fountain in the middle of the lake which start at 7pm local time.

At night, the place is very bright and mesmerising with the fountain dance.
Cool place.

Huge parking space and the
Entrance with car will cost you RM1.
If u want the receipt, u may ask for it.

Amenities:
well maintain.
Toilet: cost you RM1.
However, no other amenities like shower or gym room.

Great playground for kids. Well taken care of.

3 tracks for jogging
Outer (near to fence asphalt track)
Middle (the red and rubberised asphalt track)
Inner coarse cement track (next too the lake )

It is safe for single runner to come and jog at night.

A couple of shops open here too.

I would recommend u to come at night.. as it is the most beautiful time.

The pictures doesn't give any justice.
Let the pictures talk.

places.address: Tanjung Aru, 88100 Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Tanjung Aru Beach is a must-visit destination in Kota Kinabalu, offering a picturesque setting with its long stretch of sandy shores and vibrant food stalls. It's renowned for being an ideal spot to witness breathtaking sunsets. The beach provides a refreshing change of scenery, inviting visitors to swim in its crystal-clear waters and partake in various water sports and activities. Additionally, the area boasts numerous cafes and restaurants where you can savor delicious local cuisine.

sources.snippet: Located outside the city center, Tanjung Aru is a 2-km beach stretching from Shangri-La Resort & Spa on the northern end and the Kota Kinabalu Meteorological Office on the southern end. Because of its close proximity to the urban core, the beach developed into a popular beach hangout place. Facing the South China Sea, it showcases breathtaking sunsets, painting the sky with splashes of various hues and intensity each day, depending on the weather.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Things to Do in KOTA KINABALU, Sabah

sources.snippet: Situated on Kota Kinabaluâ€™s western coast, this beach is frequented by tourists and locals alike because of its close proximity to the airport. With fine sand and sparkling deep-blue waters, this beach offers an amazing coastal experience. You can simply relax and sunbathe in peace, or if you want something more thrilling, you can engage in some exciting water sports such as jet skiing and surfing.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things To Do In Kota Kinabalu, Malaysia

sources.snippet: Tanjung Aru Beach in Kota Kinabalu is renowned for its soft, golden sands and breathtaking sunsets. It is an ideal spot for tourists to do a little sunbathing, relax, and enjoy the tranquil sounds of the waves. With plenty of beachfront eateries and bars, indulging in local delicacies and refreshing drinks while soaking in the serene atmosphere is totally a must.
sources.shortName: 30 Best Things To Do In Kota Kinabalu Town, Tourist Attractions & More

sources.snippet: Tanjung Aru Beach is the most popular beach in Kota Kinabalu and can be found south of the Borneo Railway. Itâ€™s not surprising how popular this beach is because it is the best place to see the sunset and at the same time have access to food stalls and drinks. In the afternoon, it is a popular area for the locals to go on a long walk along the shoreline.
sources.shortName: The Best 18 Things to Do in Kota Kinabalu - Malaysian Borneo

sources.snippet: For another, there are its outstanding natural sites and tourism highlights, like Mount Kinabalu, Kota Kinabalu Islands, Tanjung Aru Beach, Kiulu River, and Tunku Abdul Rahman Marine Park. Other canâ€™t-miss attractions in the city are Gaya Street Sunday Market, KK Waterfront, Chinatown, Atkinson Clock Tower, and Signal Hill Observatory Platform.
sources.shortName: 7 BEST PLACES to visit in Kota Kinabalu + THINGS TO DO

sources.snippet: Tanjung Aru Beach, immediately south of the city, is a popular place to watch the sunset with food stalls laid out for snacks and dinner. During the evenings it can get very busy with locals. Itâ€™s not the cleanest of beaches and the sea doesnâ€™t look too inviting, but itâ€™s also worth popping down to the beach for a morning or afternoon stroll.
sources.shortName: Kota Kinabalu with kids (2025): things to do and where to stay

sources.snippet: Lying around a 20-minute drive from the city center, Tanjung Aru Beach is a delightful place to kick back and unwind. Its golden sands look out over the South China Sea, with Tunku Abdul Rahman Marine Park lying in the distance. Here you can go swimming, enjoy some fantastic water sports, or simply sunbathe to your heartâ€™s content.
sources.shortName: 12 Top Tourist Attractions in Kota Kinabalu (+Photos)

sources.snippet: Tanjung Aru Beach, located near the west coast of Kota Kinabalu is one of the most iconic attractions in Sabah. It is a great place for all types of visitors, from couples to families. With lively music and entertainment everywhere, the night time at Tanjung Aru Beach is a stark contrast to its beautiful daytime vibes.
sources.shortName: 22 Best Things to do in Kota Kinabalu Malaysia 2025

sources.snippet: No visit to Kota Kinabalu is complete without spending time at Tanjung Aru Beach. This pristine beach offers soft golden sand, crystal-clear waters, and a breathtaking view of the nearby islands. Relax under the shade of the palm trees, take a dip in the sea, or simply enjoy a picnic with friends and family.
sources.siteName: Wildlife Tours - Outback Venture Sdn Bhd
sources.shortName: Exploring Kota Kinabalu: 7 Fantastic Free Activities | Wildlife Tours

sources.snippet: Tanjung Aru Beach is one of the best loved beaches in Kota Kinabalu and is especially popular at the weekends.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Kota Kinabalu (Malaysia)

places.name: Tanjung Aru Beach

reviews.text:
April 2025
Awesome time here viewing the sunset ðŸŒ…
Several food & drinks tent here.
Note:
Please bring along -
1. Umbrella
2. Sunblock lotion
3. Water
4. Sunglasses
5. Picnic mat/ towels
6. Camera / phone camera

Pros:
1. Beautiful Sunset & sands as it's ranked No. 4 worldwide.

Cons:
1. Table & chairs by the beach are out for rental
2. Crocodile have not been spotted here!!!
(Swim at your own riskðŸ¤­)
(please see photos)

Best spot to enjoy the sunset in Kota Kinabalu.
Was first time here in year 2005. After all these years, still giving us the best sunset .

Now seeing more and more visitors... Good, but need to have a more organized traffic control.

Also need to educate everyone about civic and the need to care for the place...

Beautiful Beach, surprisingly empty during the day (maybe it was too hot), but very crowded before sunset.
Also the night market next to the beach was very nice.
The water is not deep for a long while, so you can walk with your feet in the water for a long time before reaching a deep point.

places.address: Tanjung Aru Beach Resort, Tanjung Aru, 88100 Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia

sources.snippet: To know: One of the most beautiful places where you can spend holidays with your friends with zero payment or visit if you are a tourist is the Taman Awam Teluk Likas which overlooks the South China Sea which is one of the nice Kota Kinabalu parks. Actually, there is no doubt that going there is one of the best free things to do in Kota Kinabalu. To do: During your visit to this wonderful park, you will have a chance to enjoy a lot of greenish trees, many enormous green areas, and several beautiful paths that you can walk around and relish its splendid views.
sources.shortName: Best 4 free and cheap things to do in Kota Kinabalu
Free tourist attractions in Kota Kinabalu

places.name: Taman Awam Teluk Likas, Kota Kinabalu, Sabah.

reviews.text: Went here for a jog~ The view was nice, good place to have picnic,, Since its currently puasa month, many Muslims come here for berbuka too
suitable for families to have fun and exercise with a beautiful beach view. Only one thing is spoiled, the signboard shows no fishing but still have people fishing.
Great place to jog and do photography. A significant reduction in littering after DBKK imposed fine on litterbugs

places.address: Jln Tun Fuad Stephens, 88400 Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Rasa Ria Reserve by Shangri-La is a luxurious nature-oriented resort set in a 400-acre beach meets rainforest property with its own 64-acre nature reserve. The resort offers activities for both adults and children, including spa days, an 18-hole championship golf course, and the Kids Club. Children aged four to twelve can join the Ranger Experience or take part in the Bespoked Family Tour.

sources.snippet: The Rasa Ria (Shangri-La) hotel has an Orangutan Rehabilitation Centre where you can watch 2 daily feedings of the orangutans. After they eat they usually stick around and play-swinging through the trees. Make reservations directly with the hotel.

places.name: Rasa Ria Reserve by Shangri-La

reviews.text: We spent only two nights there, and I regret not staying there from the beginning. The best hotel experience I ever had: the room at Ocean Wing has the best design, and the outdoor daybed and bathtub are amazing!! Rosslyn, Adrian and everyone at the resort were so friendly and helpful! Let me put it this way: if I ever return to Sabah, this hotel will be the main reason.

ocean wing room with balcony bathtub and ocean wing pool had lovely romantic views! and driver from airport was really patient (we made 3 pit stops lolol)

firefly guide (unfortunately didn't get his name) was humorous, horse riding, jetski, atv, archery, banana boat guides and drivers were all so friendly and knowledgeable! saw an alligator, oyster farm and sea gypsies

used lavender oil for sandflies at the beach, spf130 sunblock and basic insect repellant works. better to overpack than underpack because the weather is finnicky. scheduling and rescheduling activities would almost have been a headache if not for the patient staff.

breakfast buffet at garden wing, lunch at ocean grill and drinks at garden wing bar was alright - ended up grabfooding from Abadi restaurant (right next to jetski area) twice! amazing crab, prawns and seafood. have to shoutout to room service dining - masala prawns was DELICIOUS!

live music in the evening at garden wing bar was a thrill!

They have the best sunset, literally. Place wasn't crowded as its a private beach, and the place is very clean. Hotel is very well maintained, and you could use their washroom to clean your feet after coming out from the beach.

places.address: Pantai Dalit, Tuaran, 89208 Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia
